briefdescription.para: ATA IDENTIFY: device type offset (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: cylinder count offset (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: head count offset (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: sectors per track offset (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: serial number string offset (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: model string offset (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: capabilities word offset (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: field validity word offset (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: 28-bit max LBA (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: command sets supported offset (bytes).
ATA IDENTIFY: 48-bit max LBA (bytes).
SATA device signature: ATA drive.
SATA device signature: ATAPI (SATAPI) device.
SATA device signature: Enclosure Management Bridge.
SATA device signature: Port Multiplier.
AHCI enumerated device type: none.
AHCI enumerated device type: SATA.
AHCI enumerated device type: SEMB.
AHCI enumerated device type: Port Multiplier.
AHCI enumerated device type: SATAPI.
Interface Power Management (IPM) state: active.
Device Detection (DET) state: device present.
PxCMD: Start (ST).
PxCMD: FIS Receive Enable (FRE).
PxCMD: FIS Receive Running (FR) (read-only).
PxCMD: Command List Running (CR) (read-only).
ATA command: READ DMA EXT (48-bit).
ATA command: WRITE DMA EXT (48-bit).
ATA Status: Busy (BSY).
ATA Status: Data Request (DRQ).
Logical HDD sector size in bytes (common 512 B).
ATAPI logical sector size in bytes (2048 B).

memberdef.name: GET_SLOT
memberdef.initializer: int slot = find_cmdslot(port, abar); if (slot == -1) { return false; }

briefdescription.para: Acquire a free command slot or return false from the caller.

simplesect.para: Expands to a declaration int slot and early-return path on failure. Intended for use at the start of functions that submit commands.

detaileddescription.para: DMA activate FIS - device to host
PIO setup FIS - device to host
Set device bits FIS - device to host

briefdescription.para: Frame Information Structure (FIS) type identifiers.

detaileddescription.para: 0x00, Command List Base Address (CLB), 1 KiB aligned
Bytes transferred by HBA (read-only to host)

briefdescription.para: Register FIS: Host to Device (H2D).

detaileddescription.para: Command Table (points to CFIS/ACMD and PRDT).
Received FIS area layout in system memory (per-port).
Set Device Bits (SDB) FIS (device->host asynchronous notification).
AHCI Host Bus Adapter (HBA) memory-mapped register space.

dma_buffer_offset low 2 bits must be 0 (DWORD aligned).
transfer_count bit 0 must be 0 (even byte count).
Addresses labelled "base address" require the documented alignment (1 KiB for CLB, 256 B for FB).
Reconstruct the full ATA Status as (status_low | (status_high << 3)).
command_fis_length is measured in DWORDs (216).
prdbc is written by HBA with bytes actually transferred.
byte_count is encoded as (N - 1); N must be even; N 4 MiB.
Register FIS: Host to Device (H2D).
Generic ACPI System Description Table Header.

This structure serves as the entry point to the ACPI system description tables. Its location is typically found by scanning the BIOS memory range. It may point to either the RSDT (ACPI 1.0) or XSDT (ACPI 2.0+).
All ACPI tables begin with this header. It is used to identify table type, length, version, and source information.
Points to other system description tables using 32-bit addresses. Superseded by XSDT in ACPI 2.0+ which uses 64-bit addresses.

briefdescription.para: Initialise AHCI controller(s), enumerate ports, and register devices.
Find a free command slot on a port.

simplesect.para: Slot index [0..31] on success, -1 if none available.

memberdef.argsstring: (ahci_hba_port_t *port, uint64_t start, uint32_t count, char *buf, ahci_hba_mem_t *abar)
memberdef.name: ahci_read

briefdescription.para: Read from a SATA block device via DMA.

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (ahci_hba_port_t *port, uint64_t start, uint32_t count, char *buf, ahci_hba_mem_t *abar)

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (ahci_hba_port_t *port, uint64_t start, uint32_t count, char *buf, ahci_hba_mem_t *abar)
memberdef.name: ahci_atapi_read

briefdescription.para: Read from an ATAPI device (e.g., optical) via PACKET command.

parameterdescription.para: Number of logical blocks to read.

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error.

briefdescription.para: Query capacity (in bytes) from a SATA device using IDENTIFY data.

simplesect.para: Device size in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Build a human-readable SATA device label from IDENTIFY data.
Render a human-readable capacity string (e.g., "931 GiB").
Inspect PxSIG/PxSSTS to determine attached device type.

simplesect.para: One of AHCI_DEV_* constants.

memberdef.argsstring: (void *dev, uint64_t start, uint32_t bytes, unsigned char *buffer)

briefdescription.para: Block device read shim for the storage layer (bytes interface).

parameterdescription.para: Byte offset to read from (converted to sectors internally).

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno-style on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (void *dev, uint64_t start, uint32_t bytes, const unsigned char *buffer)

briefdescription.para: Block device write shim for the storage layer (bytes interface).

parameterdescription.para: Byte offset to write to (converted to sectors internally).

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno-style on failure.

briefdescription.para: Wait until the AHCI port and attached device are ready to accept a new command.

simplesect.para: true if ready, false on timeout or fatal port state.

briefdescription.para: Fill one PRDT entry in the command table.

parameterdescription.para: Physical or DMA-able address of the data buffer.
Number of bytes to transfer (1..4MiB per entry, device-dependent).
Set true to request interrupt on completion for this PRDT entry.

memberdef.argsstring: (ahci_hba_port_t *port, size_t slot, bool write, bool atapi, uint16_t prdtls)
memberdef.name: get_cmdheader_for_slot

briefdescription.para: Obtain and initialise a command header for a slot.

parameterdescription.para: Set true for host-to-device (write), false for device-to-host (read).
Set true for ATAPI packet command, false for ATA.
Number of PRDT entries to advertise (PRDTL).

simplesect.para: Pointer to the prepared command header.

briefdescription.para: Return the command table for a header and clear CFIS/ATAPI/reserved regions.

parameterdescription.para: Command header whose table will be accessed.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the command table.

memberdef.argsstring: (ahci_hba_cmd_tbl_t *cmdtbl, uint8_t type, uint8_t command, uint8_t feature_low)
memberdef.name: setup_reg_h2d

briefdescription.para: Prepare a Register H2D FIS in the command table.

parameterdescription.para: Command table to place the FIS into.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the FIS within the command table.

briefdescription.para: Fill LBA and sector count fields in a Register H2D FIS.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the FIS previously created by setup_reg_h2d.

briefdescription.para: Issue a prepared command in the given slot by setting PxCI.
Wait for a command slot to complete and detect transport/taskfile errors.

simplesect.para: true on success, false if a taskfile/transport error occurred (error already logged).

briefdescription.para: Convenience wrapper to issue a command and wait for completion.

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error (error already logged).

briefdescription.para: Trim trailing ASCII spaces from a NUL-terminated string in place.
Build a human-readable ATAPI device label from INQUIRY data.

parameterdescription.para: Storage device object to receive the label.

briefdescription.para: Eject removable media from an ATAPI device (ALLOW removal then START STOP with LOEJ).

parameterdescription.para: AHCI HBA port for the device.

simplesect.para: true on command acceptance, false on error (caller may fetch sense).

briefdescription.para: Issue IDENTIFY (ATA or ATAPI) and copy the 512-byte identify page to out.

parameterdescription.para: Destination buffer for identify data (512 bytes).

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error.

briefdescription.para: Issue ATAPI INQUIRY (0x12) and copy the response.

parameterdescription.para: Allocation length requested and number of bytes to copy.

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error (caller may use sense mapping).

briefdescription.para: Map AHCI/AHCI-ATA/ATAPI latched status on a port to a fixed fs_error_t without performing I/O.

detaileddescription.para: Map AHCI/AHCI-ATA/ATAPI status to a fixed fs_error_t.

port
AHCI HBA port; uses PxIS/PxSERR/PxTFD/PxSIG snapshots.
fs_error_t value describing the failure class.
Uses PxIS priority: HBFS HBDS IFS TFES. For TFES, inspects PxTFD ERR bits. For ATAPI, returns FS_ERR_ATAPI_CHECK on TFES so the caller can issue REQUEST SENSE.
This function performs no I/O; it only interprets the latched registers you pass in.

briefdescription.para: Map SCSI/ATAPI sense (sense key, ASC, ASCQ) to a fixed fs_error_t.

detaileddescription.para: Map SCSI/ATAPI sense (SK/ASC/ASCQ) to fs_error_t with fixed message.

simplesect.para: fs_error_t value describing the failure class.

briefdescription.para: Issue ATAPI REQUEST SENSE (6) and copy sense data to the caller buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Issue ATAPI REQUEST SENSE (6) and copy sense data to 'out'. Expects 'out_len' >= 18 for standard fixed-format sense. Returns true on success (command accepted and data DMA'd), false on failure.

port
AHCI HBA port.
abar
AHCI HBA memory (ABAR) pointer.
out
Destination buffer for sense data.
out_len
Allocation length requested (typically 18).
true on success, false on failure to obtain sense data.
Issue ATAPI REQUEST SENSE (6) and copy sense data to the caller buffer.

briefdescription.para: Extract sense key, ASC and ASCQ from a fixed-format (0x70/0x71) REQUEST SENSE buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Extract SK/ASC/ASCQ from a fixed-format (0x70/0x71) REQUEST SENSE buffer. Caller guarantees 'buf' points to at least 14 bytes (we usually pass 18).

briefdescription.para: Handle ATAPI CHECK CONDITION by issuing REQUEST SENSE, mapping to fs_error_t, logging a single line, and returning false.

detaileddescription.para: Convenience helper for ATAPI CHECK CONDITION paths. Issues REQUEST SENSE, extracts and maps sense, logs a single line, then returns false.

port
AHCI HBA port.
abar
AHCI HBA memory (ABAR) pointer.
function
Short label used for diagnostics/logging.
Always false to simplify call-sites that branch on failure.
Always returns false so call-sites can simply: if (!atapi_handle_check_condition(...)) return false; If REQUEST SENSE itself fails, logs a generic timeout/hardware error.

memberdef.argsstring: (ahci_hba_port_t *port, ahci_hba_mem_t *abar, const ahci_trim_caps *caps, uint64_t lba, uint32_t sectors)
memberdef.name: ahci_trim_one_range

briefdescription.para: Trim a single contiguous LBA range. No batching/merging of disjoint ranges.

simplesect.para: true on success, or if TRIM unsupported (no-op); false on submission error.

briefdescription.para: Extract TRIM/DSM capability flags from IDENTIFY DEVICE.
Compile-time size check: command header must be 0x20 bytes.
Compile-time offset check: PxCI must be at 0x38.
Compile-time offset check: SDB FIS must be at 0x58 within received FIS area.
AHCI/SATA register and FIS definitions plus driver-facing prototypes.

simplesect.para: Craig Edwards (craigedwards@brainbox.cc)
Copyright (c) 2012-2025

Bitfield layout in these structs matches x86_64 GCC/Clang ABI and AHCI 1.3.x diagrams. Bitfield layout is implementation-defined by C; if porting to other ABIs/endianness, prefer explicit masking on byte arrays.
